Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I keep seeing people suggest we 'contact' certain people to make new content, or reach out to exchanges for listings, etc. but most of the time this stuff costs money, listing fees, interview fees, etc. We should have a fundraising page since we are a community, where we have addresses dedicated to particular projects. So KMD/BTC/other addresses specifically for "exchange listing fees", or marketing, or bounty support, UX/UI developer costs. or whatever else. I'm sure we can come up with some pretty mutually exclusive/collectively exhaustive buckets to simplify it.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: For example, Development expenses, Marketing and partnerships, Listing fees, dPoW notarization fees. or something

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I always see you posting bounties @KomodoWorld which is why I suggest this

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I think the people more asking for it are probably the less likely to donate

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I agree

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: but it still stands that we should be able to point people to a location where they CAN if they want

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: and actually select where they want their funds to go. I'm not really for paying listing fees to exchanges, especially being established and on major exchanges already, so I wouldn't donate to that pool. etc

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: well, all that is needed on the website is a list of donation addresses for specific purposes

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I imagine something like this <https://airdropvenezuela.org/> where it just has simple addresses for each. and you can click on a bucket and see what exactly those funds will be used for, exclusively

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: right

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Like saying "development expenses" entails hiring 3rd party developers to fill skills needs we don't currently have in house, or expanding into areas we may not have a lot of industry expertise in (IoT devices, Supply chain development, or w.e.) things that are niche but are industries Komodo products would do well in. or even supplementing for current developers who are being paid. 
"Marketing" would be partnerships, conference costs, travel to meet person to person with execs, content providers, outreach etc.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: like I said, there are probably some pretty solid buckets we can create that are mutually exclusive and cover all reasonable ground

Content:
My revision of first page:
"Without adequate security, a blockchain project cannot thrive. Therefore it is paramount that a project's blockchain be strong enough to withstand attacks that undermine it's integrity and immutability. Traditionally, the solution was an expensive arms race of hashpower, forking mining algorithms to counter an ever-growing ASIC market, or novelty consensus mechanisms that compromise decentralization. Fortunately, there is an easy solution. Komodo‚Äôs Blockchain Security Service uses proven technology that protects every integrated blockchain with the power of the Bitcoin network, for a tiny fraction of the cost."

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content:
Thanks for the feedback and comments guys. 

@yorklab  425% growth is accurate. Jan 1, 2018 was under 2K subscribers to the subreddit. We saw a lot of growth in Jan and Feb, before the market really tanked, and then also a huge surge when we ran the infographic contest. I think we grew by 1.5K from the infographic contest alone

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: @Regnar thanks for spotting that typo, I will fix that now

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content:
About the other comments- let me explain a bit.

The first paragraph is extremely negative. This is intentional. It provides strong contrast between 1st and 2nd paragraphs, and highlights the importance of Komodo's solution.

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content:
In general, in copywriting, you want to clearly identify the problem and your "customer's pain points" in the parlance of the industry. The formula is generally explain the problem--> identify the  ways that this is problem is impacting your customer's life--> present the solution --> explain the benefits of the solution and how much better your customer's life will be after the buy your product/service

If a 51% attack is not something that a person has ever thought about or worries about, then Komodo's Blockchain Security Service is not for them. If they have worried about a 51% attack, then we essentially want to harness that negative emotion for a brief moment before introducing Komodo's solution

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Also, the copy you suggested is great @Regnar , but it's taking a different approach. You've suggested several different solutions and then present Komodo's as the best one. This method is a bit trickier and requires much more analysis. Right now, Komodo has the only third-party security solution in the blockchain space so mentioning other ways of mitigating the risk of a 51% attack probably isn't the way we want to do things. This is especially true if we don't give those other potential solutions a thorough examination at any other point in the brochure

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: As for the mention of $23 Million lost in 51% attacks, I count 3 mentions of that and each one is on a different page

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content:
It's important to remember that very few people are gonna sit down and read this things front to back. All of you guys have read every word of the brochure, which is great and I thank you for that. 

But for ordinary potential customers, I'd say we have somewhere between 1 and 2 minutes of people's attention before they move on to something else. 

In those 60--120 seconds, what do we want them to learn?

-- 51% attacks are a serious problem. More than $23 Million has been stolen in 51% attacks in the last 12 months 
-- Komodo has a third-party solution that protects any UTXO-based blockchain with the power of the BTC network
-- 6 blockchain projects are already using Komodo's Blockchain Security Service and a major crypto exchange has officially endorsed it

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: If a reader can come away with those 3 key pieces of info, this brochure is a huge win

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: One last thought-- Komodo has an awesome community and we appreciate everything you guys do to help the project. But, ultimately, our marketing materials are not made for you guys. I don't say that in any kind of mean way but you guys are just not the target audience

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: We need to grow-- our community, our developers, our social media following, our investors. That means reaching new people who have no idea what Komodo is or maybe have heard of Komodo but don't really know what the project is all about. Everything we produce will be created with this audience in mind so please bear with us if it seems like we're repeating ourselves, our like we're recycling content, or like we're just publishing the same stuff over and over. All of this is intentional.
